intro: Dipterygium glaucum, commonly known as the silverleaf mistletoe, is a parasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are typically covered in a whitish, powdery coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by red berries that are dispersed by birds. Its parasitic nature allows it to draw nutrients from its host trees, often leading to weakened or damaged host plants.
